poem:
Artificial Play  

In Beijing's dawn,  
metal limbs shiver—  
a dance of circuits,  
autonomous grace—  
whirring minds dribble  
across the green,  
aching for the touch  
of a world they mimic.  
Flesh forgotten,  
iron replaces sweat;  
yet, life's true match,  
played on grass,  
lingers in echoes  
beyond the whistle's call.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China hosts first fully autonomous AI robot football match They think it’s all over … for human footballers at least. The pitch wasn’t the only artificial element on display at a football match on Saturday. Four teams of humanoid robots took each other on in Beijing, in games of three-a-side powered by artificial intelligence. While the modern game has faced accusations of becoming near-robotic in its obsession with tactical perfection, the games in China showed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
